title: Monitor FPS / Ping issue
body: I have two monitors I use, one is an average size monitor, and the other is about 7-10 inches wider/taller. On my littler one I can play LoL perfectly with no issues. On my bigger one, LoL is completely choppy and laggy, on top of that for some reason it also makes my ping well over 1k, I've tried fiddling with settings in a custom game and on the display settings for the big monitor itself, but i cannot seem to find out how to fix it, if anyone knows or can think of a solution, i would greatly appreciate it, thanks.

replies.body: That's really strange. I've never heard of a display causing latency (ping) issues. Can you let me know the display resolutions of these monitors?
I know right, I have my resolution set to 1776x1000 on my display settings and in-game.

That's a really strange resolution. Can you try using something more standard such as *1366x768* or *1920x1080*? Make those changes both in your [Windows display settings](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/4910-screen-resolution-display-change-windows-10-a.html) and in-game.
Weird, I wasn't aware I couldn't use that res, but thanks, that helped out a bit, Its still a tad bit choppy, but much better than it was.

Glad to hear that helped a bit. Some additional steps you could take to normalize your FPS can be found in [this guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752684-Low-Frame-Rate-FPS-Troubleshooting), which mostly addresses display drivers and windows power settings.
